title: David Cameron hints Britain could strike again if Houthis continue attacking
description: Britain could strike Houthi targets in Yemen again if the rebel group continues to attack ships in the Red Sea, Foreign Secretary Lord David Cameron has suggested. Lord Cameron warned that the Iran-linked militants could force up prices in Britain if they are allowed to block the passage of container ships in the busy trade route.

title: I talked to Keir Starmer for three months: this is what I learned
description: ITV’s deputy political editor had exclusive access to the Labour leader for a TV profile to be aired this week. Is he fit to be Britain’s next PM?

title: A&E doctor's emotional plea to Sir Keir Starmer over 'national scandal' - as thousands of patients die
description: Among the wide-ranging topics – from the dangers of drill music to cracking down on knife crime – Sir Keir was faced with the stark reality of one of Greater Manchester’s experienced A&E consultants telling him that after almost three decades in emergency medicine, they know ‘the system is truly broken’.

title: David Cameron hints Britain could strike again if Houthis continue attacking
description: Britain could strike Houthi targets in Yemen again if the rebel group continues to attack ships in the Red Sea, Foreign Secretary Lord David Cameron has suggested. Lord Cameron warned that the Iran-linked militants could force up prices in Britain if they are allowed to block the passage of container ships in the busy trade route.

title: Nigel Farage's Reform UK draws up hit list of ten Conservative MPs who may defect before the General Election
description: Reform UK, of which Mr Farage is honorary president, hopes to appeal to former Tory and Ukip voters who are disillusioned with Conservative policy over immigration and years of infighting. Potential defectors will wait to see whether the Government's Rwanda Bill fails to get flights off the ground, insiders said.

title: Labour are attempting a huge con on the public with their ‘policy’ to tackle illegal migration

title: Starmer rules out reviving HS2’s cancelled northern leg
description: Birmingham to Manchester route 'not going to happen' as site won't be on the market before election, says Labour leader

title: Yemen strikes: The political fallout
description: Newscast brings you daily analysis of the latest political news stories from the BBC. It was presented by Laura Kuenssberg and Paddy O’Connell. It was made by Chris Flynn with Hanna Ward. The technical producer was Jack Graysmark.

title: Who is on Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg: Full guest list
description: IN the second Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg show of 2024, Keir Starmer and David Cameron will both appear.

title: The inside story of how Rishi Sunak made the call on airstrikes in Yemen on Houthi rebels during a trip to Ukraine
description: When the RAF 's bombs started falling on Houthi rebel positions in the early hours of Friday morning, the Prime Minister was preparing for bed in a blacked-out train in Ukraine.

title: Half a million on London march against Israeli genocide
description: People joined the Palestine march in London against Israeli genocide—and the US’s and Britain’s bombing of Yemen

title: Nottinghamshire's broken roads are not just a threat to our vehicles
description: Photos of Ashfield councillors pointing at potholes have become the stuff of ridicule in certain quarters. Such is the frequency of these snaps that the point they are trying to make, highlighting the broken state of Nottinghamshire's roads, can often be lost.

title: Keir Starmer: Labour backs strikes on Houthi rebels to protect UK
description: Those who seek to damage Britain should be in no doubt as to the seriousness of our country’s resolve in response to their aggression

title: Keir Starmer backs Yemen bombing and issues stern warning to ’terror sponsors’ Iran

title: Kuenssberg: The thorny politics of Houthi strikes for Sunak and Starmer
description: The military action is instinctively trickier territory for Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer. Sir Keir Starmer says Labour backs the western military operation against Houthi rebels in the Red Sea. Labour nerves still jangle over what went so terribly wrong in Iraq, even after all these years.

title: Public consultation on biodiversity strategy in Bury
description: Bury Council are drawing up the boroughs first biodiversity strategy to see what can be done to conserve and enhance it.

title: How Britain’s corrupt political funding helps the Right
description: With the 2024 general election set to be the dirtiest battle yet, the party which receives the most money from donors could be at a distinct advantage.

title: London lefty or Bernard Manning double? The Tories can’t demonise Keir Starmer as both
description: It’s obvious what the Labour leader meant by saying Rishi Sunak ‘didn’t get Britain’. Let’s drop the dog whistling and get back to politics

title: The World Is Watching U.S. Elections. Here's What Americans Should Be Watching.
description: The Taiwanese people went to the polls Saturday for presidential and legislative elections that will be closely watched by both the U.S., one of Taiwan’s biggest supporters on the world stage, and China, which poses a threat but is also the self-governing island’s largest trading partner.

title: CHARLIE WHELAN: I still rue to this day Gordon Brown dithering over General Election timing
description: One of those badly advising Gordon Brown was from the USA and he convinced him to delay with the argument that if he waited until the last possible moment he would have been British Prime minister longer than JF Kennedy had been US President!

title: SNP versus Labour: How will parties set out their stalls?
description: Still, the Yousaf event is significant. It is driven by ambition, of course, but also by set-back and defeat, most recently in Rutherglen.

title: Zelensky hails UK support with £2.5bn in military aid pledged for next year
description: The Prime Minister travelled to Kyiv on Friday to unveil the new funding, becoming the first foreign leader to visit Ukraine this year.
